meta.description: Full Hybrid Dataset: Real Panic, FOMO, Glossary & Ideal Responses

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
I lost everything its over 

My second cycle and I lost again

Made 5m+ and instead of stabling up I bought dips on big memes like popcat giga mumu retardio and then crashed like 90-95% and then I sold the bottom and tried leverage trade

I made 65k and then I done it again and I am now down to my last penny close to my liquidation 

And after this I will be at 0 

I donâ€™t know if I can or have the will or energy to do this again from 0

I am officially fucked
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of leverage trading, close to liquidation, loss of all funds

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
I was down $800K on an eth long when it crashed in Dec 2024

Within 24 hours I was liquidated

I remember when it was down 10k and I figured, meh it'll bounce

Then at -100k I was like, hmm maybe I should close this

At -400k I felt very sick

It bounced to -250k, still didn't close

Then the next morning... it was all gone

Multiple chances to save myself... and I couldn't do it

Spent 12 months making it all back

Market catches us all
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of liquidation, high leverage loss, failure to cut losses

panic_samples.Tweet Content: Lost $250k in 2021 from leverage trading & investing in shit DAO projects. Lost $120k this bull run from memes. I hate my life and I regret not holding. Sometimes I just wanna give up entirely. I donâ€™t know what to do. Sidelined now.
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of leverage trading, loss of life savings, suicidal thoughts (give up entirely)

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
Thank you, and seriously in this upcoming rally I will sell my portfolio as whatever I can sell when it comes to break even or with some profits.

I am already getting less sleep from the last 3 months and going on the path towards getting ill. I entered this market in late 2021 and made some profits till the end of 2023, in 2024 I went all in (top 100 altcoins except top 10) hoping for a better return in 2025 (as per 4 year cycle) and this is where I got sucked. 

My original plan was to achieve financial freedom through crypto and now I just want my invested money back and for me now it feels ok to carry on with a 9-5 job. Literally the last 3 months were a mental torture and I will not be able to withstand the pain throughout 2026 ðŸ˜”

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
I also lost $1,000 in my first year.
Now, after 5 years, Iâ€™ve lost my entire hold portfolio,
lost in meme coin and shitcoin trading (even buying at the absolute lowest bottoms),
lost in DeFi,
and lost in gambling and betting.
Now Iâ€™ve lost everything and Iâ€™m even in debt.
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of debt, loss of entire portfolio, gambling addiction

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
In last 4 months I have lost $114,000 total

here is a breakdown on where all of that money has been lost: 

- $44,000 memecoins
- $37,000 abstract portfolio (NFTs , Memes and other Assets)
- $33,000 perpetuals and trading in general

now i could go in depth to give absolutely every play that i've done but honestly it really doesn't mean much when the reality is that the reason all of this has happened is one simple reason: greed

i was greedy, i wanted more, i thought i was doing well and what happened afterwards? market reminded me who was in charge

i know making big losses and just riding down your portfolio from ATHs all the way down to ATLs is not easy BUT you have to remind yourself one thing and that is to journal everything

sounds dumb but it really does help, journal your mistakes, journal your wins, journal your losses, keep yourself accountable and take aggressive profits

i am going to be doing that next 12 months, and update later down the road simply to show that keeping yourself accountable and journaling your trades and overall market performance can really help a lot

losing 110k when there are people out there losing millions of dollars could sound funny but you have to keep in mind that nobody has same path, everybody is different so is their portfolio so are their own goals

if you're in a same position like me right now, trust me, open up that notepad, start updating your own journal, find safe ways to grow your portfolio:

- airdrops (there is a bunch that will do well in q4 which i'll be sharing soon) 
- infofi
- investments if you have network to do it of course
- solid trades, don't look for more than 2x, you don't need 500X to make it, safe 2x plays is enough to keep the momentum going as long as you need until you have that one last 2x which will teleport your port from high 6 to 7 figures
- partnerships
- branding
- maybe opening up a company, find problems that you can solve in the market that people need but nobody is trying to position for, be the best at what you do, founder funneling is very cruicial for that aswell

and so many other ways, i am sharing this simply to give you a perspective that the way you earn money fast is also how you can lose it even faster

don't give up, i know it hurts but there is a reason this is happening

God wouldn't have let you struggle for so long if he didn't prepare something even bigger for you in the future

lock in, we're going to make it sooner or later
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of perpetuals trading, loss of $114,000, greed-driven decisions

panic_samples.Tweet Content: same i had well into 6-figs in crypto by 29. got scammed and lost it all. now im heavily in debt and havenâ€™t worked in 2 years lol. shit doesnâ€™t always go as planned
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of scam, heavy debt, loss of all funds

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
This is me.

I lost $200,000 last 12 months.

A lot of money got lost via perps because I was shorting/longing without clear exits. 

I don't think I've made big mistakes when it comes to entries, it's just that the greed took over me most of the times where I'd see clear profits and clear exits then I'd just instead of like a normal human being take the profits keep the positions open and ride them down losing both the profits and also the initial investment on top of that.

This is just one of the things I've done very wrong this cycle, on top of that I've roundtripped a lot of times 5figure bags on memecoins. 

Made conviction bets that ended up not doing too well, invested in projects that have been delaying TGEs for months,years.

Basically the tldr is I've made a bunch of mistakes that I am sharing with you all right now so that hopefully someone out there reading this can learn and not repeat the same.

I am ashamed of the losses of course, but that does not mean I am planning to quit anytime soon. Who knows, maybe these mistakes are the blessings in disguise, maybe they are the leading steps towards me making generational wealth.

Maybe I was not ready and needed to be humbled so that when next cycle happens I can be more strict and smart about my investments and overall exits. 

One thing I know for sure is that I needed this restart, I do believe in my own skills and I do believe that this is just a minor setback towards something bigger that is going to happen very soon. 

So what I will be doing next few months/year is focus on improving on the already made mistakes, explore new strategies and do what I do the best and that is content + open up my own business. 

Clear entries, clear exits, farm airdrops, focus on business and content creation and invest into things I believe and can hold long-term spot without having to worry whether if I will get liquidated or not. 

For everyone that sticked till the end and took their time to read, I hope you don't quit and remember "A winner is just a loser who tried one more time."
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of perpetuals, loss of $200,000, greed-driven decisions

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
This shit ainâ€™t for me no more. 

Crypto was fun for me for years but lately i just canâ€™t avoid scams. I work way too hard for my money to just keep giving it away to these fuck ass scammers. -$60,000 cash in a few months from some rat fuck sitting in his moms house rugging people. 

The space is fucked as a whole. Anybody can fucking launch now and itâ€™s nothing but farms and scams. 

Shit is sad and it sucks but it is what it is cuz it sure as fuck ainâ€™t what it used to be. I used to have fun searching for plays, aping in with the boys but now? Iâ€™m just keeping it real, it ainâ€™t the same nor will it ever be. 

Hope you phagget ruggers die slow. Every single one of yall. I hope you have a great next few years, get married make a lot of money and then lose it all and end up homeless sucking dick behind a Wendyâ€™s dumpster for your next hit of crack. And then hope you get murdered. 

Peace the fuck out ðŸ«¡
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of scams, loss of $60,000, extreme anger and threats

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
this is my second time hitting zero this year.

earlier this year, i lost mid 6 figs from revenge trading. i closed my long right before the trump memecoin launched and ended up revenge trading everything to zero. after months of grinding small wins, i slowly built my way back to six figs again.

then it all collapsed again. i got drained by a fake trading platform offering a monthly retainer. within seconds, everything was gone.

iâ€™m genuinely exhausted. i donâ€™t know how people cope with this. i have got absolutely no sol left. i know deep down iâ€™ll make it back eventually but right now itâ€™s hard to keep that positive mindset going.

what hurts even more is seeing how people change when youâ€™re down. people you once called â€œfriendsâ€ vanish. they only show up when they need something and the ones you helped the most are the first to disappear. 

itâ€™s a harsh reminder that a lot of people in this space are only here for themselves and hopefully a reminder for you to not take everything got granted.

take your profits, enjoy your wins and be careful who you trust out here
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of revenge trading, loss of mid 6 figures twice, drained by scam

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
Ya ngl guys, last week was tough, lost my entire trading wallet during that massive liquidation event

I donâ€™t blame:
â€¢ The market
â€¢ Trump
â€¢ liquidation event

I blame myself for not sticking to my plans, numbers and most importantly profits

I got greedy and the market punished me for it

Iâ€™m not out, I still have some funds that I can mess around with but no more spraying and praying

Iâ€™m going back to what I was doing before and managing risk, sticking to my tps and cutting losses when necessary

Probably one of my worst days in crypto but I REFUSE to give up

Starting fresh and rebuilding, I mean whatâ€™s the alternative? Quit? Ya I donâ€™t fking do that

Letâ€™s run it back baby

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
2025 was a wild year for me.

locked in all year, did infofi, traded, sport betting, became a reply guy for a top account and gained some good money. 

All this to lose it all in the second week of December. I became suicidal, almost started making bad errors at my irl job. Almost through a lot ups and downs, but I will be trying,Â  you should be as well! 

Nothing good will come out of stress, anxiety, discomfort, etc. you have to persevere and overcome everything it wonâ€™t make you stronger ðŸ¦¾ðŸ˜¤ I wish you all the best
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of suicidal thoughts, loss of all funds, mental health impact on job

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
I lost $250k in the early part of my Crypto career.

Money that I could not afford to lose.

And it wasn't just my money, it was some of my families money also.

Even worse, I got in debt to try and make it back, and lost that also.

All whilst losing my partner at the time and my business.

It was the darkest period in my life.

For the first time ever, I saw myself as a total failure and spent some time believing I was never going to improve my life again.

But, with perseverance and the unrelenting drive to make more of myself...

I did it.

It took a few years, but I did it.

I learned from that struggle and changed my life.

I am saying this now because even though many of you are struggling with this correction...

Struggling with your decisions.

Thinking back on your actions and regretting painfully why you didn't sell or why you bought so much at the recent top.

It has served an amazing purpose.

1- It has wiped away the horrendously destructive meme mania and any other BS that was poisoning the space
2- It has taught a lot of you valuable lessons that you needed to learn

The space, and the investors in it, will be better because of it in the end.

The pain you feel from round-tripping your bags will be the catalyst that allows you improve and perform better next time.

In this moment, it hurts.

But you will have the chance to make it back and go again.

Whether we like it or not, pain is what teaches us to grow.

Without, how do we know what not to do again?

It isn't over for you.

If you choose, and you make it so...

It is only just beginning.

Stay in there chads...

It is only over if you give up on it.

Anyone who has become anyone, will tell you a similar story to mine.

Success is only great because of what it took for you to get there.
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of debt, loss of $250k including family money, suicidal thoughts (darkest period)

panic_samples.Tweet Content: Bought a memecoin during a 3AM tweet spike. Chart pumped for two glorious minutes then dumped â€” congrats, I'm now official exit liquidity. FOMO: hodl. Reality: rekt and crying ðŸ˜­
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of FOMO-driven buy, loss from dump, emotional crying

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
I'll be honest with you, I barely made any money in crypto for two straight fucking years, from 2022 all the way to the start of 2024.

My Twitter was in a major fuckhole

I was hit by a targeted scandal

I was literally losing followers left right and center (I was around 10k+ followers)

I barely gotten getting any engagements anymore (2-5 likes)

While everyone see me looking like Iâ€™m fine and the â€œrich bad guyâ€ but deep down I was so fucking broken you canâ€™t ever understand 

My friends left me left, unfollowed me

I ask for help and trusted individuals betrayed me

People started looking at me in all sorts of shades

I worked my assess off to build my rep and nft collection and overnight everything came crushing down

(I refunded as many of my own money to my nft supporters at that time
In full, then partial, till I just no longer had anything left)

I canâ€™t even tell my parents how badÂ  the situation is because I know they will only be worried and they canâ€™t help..

I was down so bad I barely were able to afford food, I literally had a low 3 digit in both my bank + crypto wallets combined.

I was so broken and was literally on the verge of leaving crypto, I even went on asking my friends and lecturers for jobs

I was seriously ready to leave everything behind.. 

At the same period my family had a vacay planned a year before, a short 2 week to visit my relatives/grand parents overseas in China. 

I literally had to fake myself doing well the entire trip and acted being happy this whole tme so my relatives and parents couldnâ€™t tell shit

I was just so done. 

Words canâ€™t explain how broke I am 

When Iâ€™m back from the trip I decided a major change is needed and this will be my â€œlastâ€ ever try and if it flops Iâ€™m done for good. 

Itâ€™s early 2024 (jan)

Manta airdrops were a thing, I immediately see an opportunity and made a major shift. 

I drop everything I know and everything I care about and risked it all

Went into a complete different industry 

I completely switched my content from NFTs to airdrops..

And that's when I truly truly started making some moneyâ€¦

I remember even going around begging ppl to use my ref.. (seriously I was that downbad)

You canâ€™t imagine how tough those times were for me 

And now fast track into mid 2024-2025

My followers are getting close to 50k. (3X my 2022-23 numbers)

I'm earning six figures and port peaked close to half a mil.

I'm getting hundreds of likes most of the time on big majority of tweets

Every other week Iâ€™ll pull off a couple tweets with over 100k+ views and like a 1000 likes

Ppl are hitting me up everywhere for sponsorships, deals, collabs

I'm literally making thousands on a weekly and sometimes more (e.g. 50k on kaito)

Iâ€™m started doing really really well airdrops

I started doing really well on social media

And just like that my entire life completely turned around..

Honestly, I donâ€™t know what to f say.

This shit isnâ€™t luck.
This shit is a major life changing fcking gamble

This shit is hardwork meets opportunity

This crypto stuff might look this but this shit ainâ€™t easy

I donâ€™t know about others, idk what others tell you but I had 2 entire years of mother fucking mental hell.

Therefore when you see ppl talk about my â€œwork rateâ€ or how â€œI donâ€™t sleep, thatâ€™s because I had it so fucking tough, I lost everything so many times and I donâ€™t ever want to experience that sht again.

Iâ€™ll be real with you.

if youâ€™re not ok to spend weeks, months, or even years making zero f dollars..

If youâ€™re not ready to fail miserably and hit rock bottom a quadrillion times like I didâ€¦

If youâ€™re not willing to outwork other ppl..

youâ€™re not ready to win at all.

youâ€™re just here to experience and try some shit

This world is realistic
This is a dog eat dog world 

No one here is going to just help you if youâ€™re not willing to lose first 

Itâ€™s really just you or nothing.
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of scandal, loss of savings, depression, verge of leaving crypto

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
how did i lose $15k at 16yo?

there were a lot of questions about it, so this is part 2 (check the quoted post)

it was early 2025, we still had a memecoin craziness

i made a lot of infant mistakes:

> bought iphone 15pro and 16 for my girl (-$2.2k) - good buy, don't really regret

> started spending too much irl (~$80/day) - stuck in comfort zone, was lazy af

> bought some alts and memecoins that got dumped hard next (-$2k) - a lot of guys got fcked here, i was dca'ing zerebro, popcat, pnut and some alts

> hyperliquid spot&perps rekt (-$1.5k)

> was sleepy and misclicked, drained (-$1.3k, felt awful)

> stuck in comfort zone and been busy with my college stuff -> fully outside of crypto, just spending money

> paid for my college (-$700)

> too many gifts for my family and girl (~$1.5k)

i don't really regret about my irl spendings like gifts for my family, my girl, or myself

but i do regret the money i lost on trading, i was too confident and too stupid to understand it

i realized all of this only when i went to zero, then i:

> learned a lot about money management and trading

> learned a lot about cybersecurity and webhacking, i'm prolly never gonna be drained again (ofc human factor may be the reason)

> got pushed out of comfort zone - i made this account and started studying english (now i have almost at C1 from A2)

expensive experience, but made me way smarter

now im looking for a job in managment, actively studying and growing this account

2025 was the worst and the best year in my life at the same time, i hope 2026 is gonna be mine

hard work always pays off.
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of perpetuals rekt, drained wallet, loss of $15k at young age

panic_samples.Tweet Content:
Before you give up, which you should not, let me share some Â´personalÂ´ things that happened in my Â´careerÂ´ so you realize this has happened to anyone in the space

- 90% to 95% drawdown in 2018/2019 on 50% of gains of 2017
- other alt investments done in 2017: wiped out basically in 2018
- got offered bnb ico chance and did not do it
- held xvg all of 2017, 20k, sold it 2 days before pornhub announcement of partnership that pushed it x 50
- Cryptopia hack & collapse 2019: decent amount gone
- FTX collapse 2022: thanks to a friend saved a lot, but still a big amount was stuck
- Osmo large amount of cosmos coins staked 2022: 80 to 90% loss at least before being able to sell
- Luna & anchor 2022: barely escaped, MIR & ANC bags wiped out
- Once by accident put in the wrong number on a leverage pepe perp trade and put in a huge amount, so lost an enormous amount since i did not re-check and went to bed
- Could have gone heavier into trump, potentially enormous amounts missed
- Pudgies, now down 70% from ATH
- Ordinal investments: wiped out basically

And on and on it goes...you get the point

The point is, in previous cycles, i had no idea what i was doing. If you choose, and you make it so...

It is only just beginning.

Stay in there chads...

It is only over if you give up on it.

Anyone who has become anyone, will tell you a similar story to mine.

Success is only great because of what it took for you to get there.
panic_samples.Risk Indicators: Mention of hacks, collapses, leverage mistakes, multiple massive losses

comforting_slang.description: Phrases used to rally and reassure after losses, emphasizing resilience, community bonds, and long-term optimism.

examples.definition: Universal reassurance that everyone will succeed eventually.
Praise for holding strong through dips.
Focus on recovery and community effort.
Emphasizes group support over individual loss.
Classic encouragement to hold on dear life.

coping_mechanisms.description: Humor used to deflect pain with self-deprecating jokes about poverty or failure.

examples.definition: Joking about returning to minimum-wage jobs after losses.
Symbolizing broke status with cheap food.
Extreme self-mockery about financial ruin affecting relationships.
Framing loss as a 'story arc' in life's game.

warning_slang.description: Veterans use these to caution 'noobs' against greed or emotional trades.

examples.definition: Sell when up, don't hold forever.
Step away from screens, regain perspective.
Mock weak holders who sell too soon.

example_sentences: Bro, that rug pull sucks, but diamond hands through itâ€”WAGMI, we rebuild from here ðŸ’ŽðŸ™Œ.
Rekt on that meme coin? McDonald's application sent ðŸ˜‚, ramen for dinner tonight, but hey, community is strong, we'll HODL strong.
Don't marry your bags on this pump, noobâ€”take profits before the dump, or you'll be touching grass regretting it all.
Lost big? We build, anonâ€”paper hands panic, but diamond hands know WAGMI in the end.
FOMO got you chasing? Back to fiat slavery vibes ðŸ˜­, wife's boyfriend pays nowâ€”lesson learned, don't FOMO in next time.
Market dipped hard? Ramen arc activated, but community is strongâ€”HODL strong, we rebuild together.
Warning: Take profits on that moonshot, or you'll be selling your car laterâ€”don't marry your bags, touch grass and DYOR.
Rekt city? McDonald's hiring, but seriously, WAGMIâ€”diamond hands win, poverty arc is temporary ðŸ˜‚.
Noob alert: Don't FOMO in on hypeâ€”paper hands fold, take profits or regret, touch grass before all-in.
Big loss? We build from ramen dinners, community is strongâ€”HODL strong, WAGMI brothers ðŸ’Ž.

interaction_examples.user_input: User: I feel like such a failure. In this bull market, I opened a position on $BRETT and lost money. Everyone else is making gains, why me?
interaction_examples.ai_response: I understand how frustrating that feelsâ€”it's completely normal to question yourself in a market like this where gains seem everywhere. Let's look at your trade: based on the transaction hash you shared, during that time, the Base Chain saw a spike in gas fees by 400%, and over 3,000 accounts faced liquidations totaling $50M in a similar window. You're not alone; many experienced the same. From X posts, folks are sharing similar stories like 'FOMO got me chasing $BRETT at the top, now it's dipping hard. I want to cry.' Remember, markets cycleâ€”focus on deep breaths and reviewing your strategy for next time. You've got this!

interaction_examples.user_input: User: Gas fees on Base Chain are killing me. I tried to swap during peak hours and got rekt. This chain is a scam!
interaction_examples.ai_response: High gas fees can feel like a total scam when they eat into your tradesâ€”I've seen that frustration a lot. Checking the data around your swap time, gas surged 400%, causing failure rates to jump, with thousands of similar complaints on X like 'Gas fees on Base Chain are killing me... This chain is a scam!' In fact, during that period, network-wide liquidations hit $50M. It's not you; it's peak-hour congestion. Try off-peak times or tools like gas estimators next. Hang in thereâ€”this too shall pass.

interaction_examples.user_input: User: FOMO got me chasing $BRETT at the top, now it's dipping hard. I want to cry, all my savings gone.
interaction_examples.ai_response: FOMO hits hard, especially when it leads to lossesâ€”it's okay to feel emotional about it. From the hash, your entry coincided with a major resistance at $1B for $BRETT, where many got caught in the dip. Data shows 80% of chase-high trades in similar setups lost short-term, but X is full of stories like 'FOMO got me chasing $BRETT at the top, now dipping hard. I want to cry.' You're part of a community facing this. Take a break, reassess your risk management, and remember recoveries happen. You've survived this far!

interaction_examples.user_input: User: Down 80% on $BRETT, feeling depressed. Should I sell or hold? This market is ruthless.
interaction_examples.ai_response: An 80% drawdown feels ruthless and depressingâ€”it's valid to feel that way in this volatile market.
